content.title: Retroperitoneal Fibrosis
content.description: Fibroinflammatory process encasing retroperitoneal structures including aorta and ureters

key_concepts.details: Idiopathic (most common), inflammatory aortic aneurysm, drugs (ergots, methysergide), IgG4-related
Periaortic/peri-iliac fibrosis; may cause ureteral obstruction, venous compression
CT shows soft tissue rind around aorta; distinguishing from inflammatory aneurysm important
Corticosteroids for idiopathic; tamoxifen; ureteral stenting; surgical ureterolysis

content.clinical_significance: Consider in AAA patients with periaortic tissue mass and ureteral involvement
